column2: Sanlúcar de Barrameda is also home to the oldest horse races in Spain and some of the oldest in Europe. The races take place just before sunset along the beach at the mouth of the river Guadalquivir every August before thousands of spectators.  Contested at distances of 1500 m and 1800 m
column3: these were the first regulated horse races in Spain; the riders wear distinctive colours and caps.

column3: there were marked distinctions between the people living in each area.  People living near the sea
column4: in the area known as Bajo de Guía
column5: were almost exclusively dedicated to fishing. Now these same people combine fishing with managing restaurants that rely on fresh fish and shellfish for their menus.  People living in the higher elevations away from the sea
